member.name: T:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps
member.summary: Defines entry points for semiconductor common steps.
This file contains shared methods and other definitions used by multiple TestStand steps.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.AcquireAnalogInputWaveforms(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Acquires an analog waveform for each of the specified pins and pin groups. This step performs a simple acquisition of an analog signal, computes the minimums and maximums of the acquired waveforms, and then publishes the results. Only pins mapped to an analog input channel of a NI-DAQmx instrument are supported.
member.param: The number of samples to read on each NI-DAQmx analog input channel.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.BurstPattern(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Bursts a pattern and publishes the pass/fail results as well as the fail count.
member.param: The name of the pattern to burst.

member.summary: Performs a basic continuity test. It serially checks either upper or lower protection diodes DUT pins, regardless of if they are mapped to digital or SMU instruments. The test will first set 0V on all the pins and then source a small amount of current on the targeted continuity pins to validate the voltage drop across the protection diode. After current is applied, the targeted pin(s) will be forced back to 0V before continuing on to the next pin. Note that each continuity pin will be tested one pin at a time. Pins mapped to either an NI SMU or NI PPMU(s) instrument channel are supported.
member.param: The supply pins or pin groups.
The current limits for every supply pin or pin group, in amperes.
The continuity pins or pin groups.
The current levels for every continuity pin or pin group, in amperes.
The voltage limit high for every continuity pin or pin group, in volts.
The voltage limit low for every continuity pin or pin group, in volts.
The measurement aperture time in seconds.
The amount of time to wait before measuring the voltage, in seconds.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.DutPowerDown(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Forces DC voltage to Zero on the specified DUT supply pins. If the Boolean is set to True, the DUT supplies will be powered down sequentially in the order provided, and the input will be used after power down each pin. If is set to false, the will be configured to force 0V at the currently programmed current limit and range, which may not be desirable. Otherwise, it will default to true, which will ensure the pins are configured to force 0V at the lowest possible current limit to mimic high-impedance. The actual current limit selected is dependent on the mapped hardware channel. Both DCPower and Digital PPMU pins are supported.
member.param: The DUT supply pins or pin groups.
The amount of time to wait before continuing, in seconds.
Whether to power down DUT supplies sequentially.
Whether to force lowest current limit (100nA) for safety considerations.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.DutPowerUp(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Forces DC voltage on the specified DUT supply pins. Must provide voltages and current limit values for each of the DUT supply pins. If the Boolean is set to True, the DUT supplies will be powered up sequentially in the order provided, and the input will be used after power up each pin. Both DCPower and Digital PPMU pins are supported.
member.param: The DUT supply pins or pin groups.
The DC voltage level to force on each DUT supply pin or pin group, in volts.
The current limit for each DUT supply pin or pin group, in amperes.
The amount of time to wait before continuing, in seconds.
Whether to power up DUT supplies sequentially.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.ForceCurrentMeasureVoltage(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Forces the specified DC current on all pins and/or pin groups specified, waits the specified amount of settling time, and then measures the voltage on those pins and publishes the results to TestStand. Note that the voltage measurements are published separately for each pin, regardless of if a pin group is provided, using the following Published Data Id: Voltage. Both DCPower and Digital PPMU pins are supported. Both the settlingTime and apertureTime inputs are expected to be provided in Seconds. By default the apertureTime input is set to -1, which will cause this input to be ignored and the device will use any pre-configured aperture time set by a proceeding set, such as the Setup NI-DCPower Instrumentation step. The absolute value of voltage limit will be applied symmetrically (i.e if voltageLimit = 1, the output voltage will be limited between -1V and +1V). An exception will be thrown if the specified limit value is outside the high-end of the voltage limit range for any of the mapped instruments. For Digital PPMU pins, since the voltage range of the digital pattern instruments is typically not symmetrically (i.e. -2V to 6V), the low-end of the applied voltage limit will be coerced to within range (i.e if voltageLimit = 3, the output voltage will be limited between -2V and +3V).
member.param: The pins or pin groups to force DC voltage on.
The DC current level to force, in amperes.
The measurement aperture time in seconds.
The amount of time to wait before continuing, in seconds.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.ForceDcCurrent(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Forces the specified DC current on all pins and/or pin groups specified. Both DCPower and Digital PPMU pins are supported. If a value is provided to the settlingTimeInSeconds input, the method will wait the specified amount of settling time before continuing. The absolute value of voltage limit will be applied symmetrically (i.e if voltageLimit = 1, the output voltage will be limited between -1V and +1V). An exception will be thrown if the specified limit value is outside the high-end of the voltage limit range for any of the mapped instruments. For Digital PPMU pins, since the voltage range of the digital pattern instruments is typically not symmetrically (i.e. -2V to 6V), the low-end of the applied voltage limit will be coerced to within range (i.e if voltageLimit = 3, the output voltage will be limited between -2V and +3V).
member.param: The pins or pin groups to force DC voltage on.
The DC current level to force, in amperes.
The amount of time to wait before continuing, in seconds.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.ForceDcVoltage(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Forces the specified DC voltage on all pins and/or pin groups specified. Both DCPower and Digital PPMU pins are supported. If a value is provided to the settlingTimeInSeconds input, the method will wait the specified amount of settling time before continuing.
member.param: The pins or pin groups to force DC voltage on.
The DC voltage level to force, in volts.
The amount of time to wait before continuing, in seconds.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.ForceVoltageMeasureCurrent(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Forces the specified DC voltage on all pins and/or pin groups specified, waits the specified amount of settling time, and then measures the current on those pins and publishes the results to TestStand. Both DCPower and Digital PPMU pins are supported. Both the and inputs are expected to be provided in Seconds. By default the input is set to -1, which will cause this input to be ignored and the device will use any pre-configured aperture time set by a proceeding set, such as the Setup NI-DCPower Instrumentation step.
member.param: The pins or pin groups to force DC voltage on.
The DC voltage level to force, in volts.
The measurement aperture time in seconds.
The amount of time to wait before continuing, in seconds.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.CommonSteps.LeakageTest(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a single leakage measurement using the following test method: 1. The test first configures the instruments connected to the specified pins and ensures they are forcing 0V. 2. The specified voltage is then forced on each pin. 3. After the specified settling time, the current is measured on each pin. 4. Each pin is then configured back to forcing 0V. 5. Finally, the output on each pin is disabled. Pins mapped to either an NI SMU or NI PPMU(s) instrument channel are supported. By default, steps 2-4 are preformed in parallel, across all pins simultaneously. When the serialOperationEnabled Boolean input parameter is set to true, steps 2-4 are preformed serially, for each pin or pin group, one at a time. Pins within pin groups are always operated on in parallel. The following Published Data Id is used for test results on a per-pin basis: Leakage. Note that the leakage current measurements are published separately for each pin, regardless of if a pin group is provided. Each test evaluation defined in the Test tab of the calling TestStand step must specify a pin. To perform the leakage test on some DUT pins in parallel but not others, use the serialOperationEnabled Boolean input parameter and define separate pin groups (i.e. LeakageOddPins and LeakageEvenPins).
member.param: The DC voltage level to force, in Volts.
The measurement aperture time in seconds.
The amount of time to wait before measuring the current, in seconds.
Whether to enforce testing sequentially across pins or pin groups.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps
member.summary: Defines entry points for semiconductor setup and cleanup steps.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.CleanupInstrumentation(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.Boolean,NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.NIInstrumentType)
member.summary: Closes any open instrument sessions associated with the pin map. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset before closing the session (default = False). The sessions will always be closed in parallel. By default, the input is set to All, which closes sessions for all instrument types in parallel. This can be configured to target a specific instrument type, which can be useful for debugging purposes and/or if there is a need to ensure sessions are closed sequentially (requiring multiple instances of this step). Note that the following types are supported: niDCPower, niDigitalPattern, niRelayDriver, niDAQmx, niDMM, niScope, niFGen, and niSync.
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.
The type of instrument to close.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.ResetInstrumentation(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.Boolean,NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.NIInstrumentType)
member.summary: Resets the instrument sessions for the specified associated with the pin map by invoking the Reset() method of the supported instrument driver. By default, the input is set to All, which targets all supported instrument types in parallel. This can be configured to target a specific instrument type, which can be useful for debugging purposes and/or if there is a need to ensure instruments are reset individually or sequentially (requiring multiple instances of this step). Note that the following types are supported: niDCPower, niDigitalPattern, niRelayDriver, niDMM, niScope, niFGen, and niSync. For instrumentation that also have the ResetDevice() method (hard reset), this can optionally be invoked instead of the Reset() method (soft-reset) if the input is set True (default = False): niDCPower, niDigitalPattern, niScope, and niFGen. Refer to the individual instrument driver documentation for more details.
member.param: Whether to perform a hard reset on the device.
The type of instrument to reset.

member.summary: Initializes an NI DAQmx Analog Input Task associated with the pin map. The value of string must match that of the DAQmx task definition within the pin map (default ="AI"). Note that the task will only be configured upon exiting this step, it will not be running.
member.param: The terminal configuration of the analog input channel.

member.summary: Initializes an NI DAQmx Analog Output Function Generation Task associated with the pin map. The value of string must match that of the DAQmx task definition within the pin map (default ="AOFuncGen"). Note that the task will only be configured upon exiting this step, it will not be running. This type of task is only supported by certain NI DAQmx hardware, such as the 4468.
member.param: The kind of waveform to generate.
The terminal configuration of the analog output channel.

member.summary: Initializes an NI DAQmx Analog Output Task associated with the pin map. The value of string must match that of the DAQmx task definition within the pin map (default ="AO"). Note that the task will only be configured upon exiting this step, it will not be running.
member.param: The terminal configuration of the analog output channel.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.SetupNIDAQmxDITask(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ChannelLineGrouping)
member.summary: Initializes an NI DAQmx Digital Input Task associated with the pin map. The value of string must match that of the DAQmx task definition within the pin map (default ="DI"). Note that the task will only be configured upon exiting this step, it will not be running.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.SetupNIDAQmxDOTask(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ChannelLineGrouping)
member.summary: Initializes an NI DAQmx Digital Output Task associated with the pin map. The value of string must match that of the DAQmx task definition within the pin map (default ="DO"). Note that the task will only be configured upon exiting this step, it will not be running.

Initializes the NI DCPower instrument sessions associated with the pin map. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset as the session is initialized (default = False). If the is set to -1 the method will not set the source delay property, and will assume the initialized default value from the driver, which is expected to be the inverse of the power line frequency. If the is set to -1, the method will attempt to automatically determine the power line frequency and set the power line frequency property for the respective driver sessions. If the power line frequency cannot be determined, the property will not be set and the driver will use the default value of this property (60 Hz). This is currently only supported by systems that use a PXIe-109x chassis or newer.
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.SetupNIDigitalPatternInstrumentation(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes an NI Digital Pattern instrument sessions associated with the pin map. It loads in all digital project files associated with the digital project configured for the test program, this includes the: pin map, specifications, patterns, source waveforms, capture waveforms, timing sheets, and levels sheets. No sheets will be applied during this setup step unless specified by the and/or inputs. Otherwise, the program will not assume to know loaded sheet to apply and will expect that the users program will apply the appropriate sheet(s) within a proceeding step. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset as the session is initialized (default = False).
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.
The name of the levels sheet to apply.
The name of the timing sheet to apply.
Whether to apply the data in waveform files to source waveforms.

member.summary: Initializes NI DMM instrument sessions associated with the pin map. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset as the session is initialized (default = False). If the is set to -1, the method will attempt to automatically determine the power line frequency and set the power line frequency property for the respective driver sessions. If the power line frequency cannot be determined, the property will not be set and the driver will use the default value of this property (60Hz). This is currently only supported by systems that use a PXIe-109x chassis or newer. If the is specified, all DMM sessions will be configured to the specified measurement function (not configured by default).
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.SetupNIFGenInstrumentation(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes NI FGEN instrument sessions associated with the pin map. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset as the session is initialized (default = False).
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.SetupNIRelayModules(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes NI Switch instrument sessions and NI DAQmx tasks associated with relay modules within the pin map. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset as the session is initialized (default = False). If the input is provided, the step will apply the specified relay configuration. Note that the relay configuration must be defined within the pin map, otherwise the step will throw an exception. Supported devices: PXI-2567 and PXIe-6368. This method expects each NI DAQmx task associated with relays in the pin map to have the Task Type set to "DAQmxRelay".
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.
The initial relay configuration to apply.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.SetupNIScopeInstrumentation(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes NI Scope instrument sessions associated with the pin map. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset as the session is initialized (default = False).
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SemiconductorTestLibrary.TestStandSteps.SetupAndCleanupSteps.SetupNISyncInstrumentation(NationalInstruments.TestStand.SemiconductorModule.CodeModuleAPI.ISemiconductorModuleContext,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the NI Sync instrument sessions associated with the pin map. If the input is set to True, then the instrument will be reset as the session is initialized (default = False).
member.param: Whether to reset device during initialization.
